ranked_diseases.disease_name: Mitochondrial myopathy, encephalopathy, lactic acidosis, and stroke-like episodes (MELAS)
ranked_diseases.explanation: MELAS is a mitochondrial disorder that often presents with ophthalmoplegia, ptosis, respiratory insufficiency, and muscle weakness (asthenia), which are all present in this patient. Dysphagia can also occur due to muscle involvement.
Myasthenia gravis is an autoimmune disorder characterized by muscle weakness (asthenia), ptosis, and ophthalmoplegia. Dysphagia and respiratory insufficiency can occur in severe cases.
OPMD typically presents with ptosis, ophthalmoplegia, and dysphagia. Respiratory insufficiency and generalized weakness (asthenia) can occur in later stages.
Kearns-Sayre syndrome is a mitochondrial disorder characterized by ophthalmoplegia, ptosis, and respiratory insufficiency. Muscle weakness (asthenia) and dysphagia may also be present.
Congenital myasthenic syndromes can present with ptosis, ophthalmoplegia, and muscle weakness (asthenia). Dysphagia and respiratory insufficiency may occur in severe cases.
